item.title: By: Jos√© Valim
item.dc:creator: Jos√© Valim
item.description:
@drnic, yes! In thor, we have the Thor::Actions (with create_file, copy_file,template and so on) and the Thor::Shell. The thor actions only delegates to a file_collision method in the thor shell.
So besides providing a file collision menu by default, you can easily reimplement the file collision menu as you wish. :) For example, Thor ships with two shell implementations, one basic and another with color. The former is only used on Windows (where terminal colors does not work by default).
item.content:encoded:
@drnic, yes! In thor, we have the Thor::Actions (with create_file, copy_file,template and so on) and the Thor::Shell. The thor actions only delegates to a file_collision method in the thor shell.

So besides providing a file collision menu by default, you can easily reimplement the file collision menu as you wish. üôÇ For example, Thor ships with two shell implementations, one basic and another with color. The former is only used on Windows (where terminal colors does not work by default).

item.title: By: Dr Nic
item.dc:creator: Dr Nic
item.description: If generators are created with thor, do you get the conflict resolution options that you currently get with rails generators when a file/folder already exists? (force, skip, show diff, etc)
item.content:encoded: If generators are created with thor, do you get the conflict resolution options that you currently get with rails generators when a file/folder already exists? (force, skip, show diff, etc)
